05/23/2024 10:56 PM Melinda Ireland: 
Application Name/Title  (Please use the proper full name from the app website or app store.)
- Alexa Echo Dot

Who is the Provider/Developer?
- Amazon

Please provide any contact information you might have for the Provider/Developer (e.g. name, email, phone number, etc.).
- Amazon

How will the application be used in your Board? (e.g., with senior students preparing for the workforce, a video conferencing app used by students, etc. ) Provide details to assist VASP assessors with understanding the purpose of using the app.
- Hi!

I hope you are having a great week. 

I am writing to inquire about my Alexa. I have used an Alexa in my classroom for the last 6 years. It changed my whole classroom for the positive and I never dreamed how difficult it would be to live without it. Since the network change, my Alexa will not connect to the internet. I used it for everything and not only am I missing it but my students need it. 

Maybe I shouldn’t rely on technology as much as I do with it in the classroom but it truly helped me through every day. I’ve been so frustrated every day since all the amazing routines I had established have been taken away. 

Why was it so important?

It helped me remember everything from doing the attendance, parent phone calls, student pick-ups to send to the office on time, volunteers coming to help, starting a lesson on time if it didn’t coordinate with the bells set, messages to deliver to people, sending library books back on time, making sure papers were passed out at the end of the day. The list is endless. I have forgotten so much and with that, there have been many negative consequences. 

I can easily set alarms for reading, writing, body breaks, etc. from anywhere in the room, at any given time. This saves a lot of time walking to my computer and finding a YouTube or Promethean board timer. Therefore I don’t waste any learning time. 

I set about 5 different timers throughout the day with quick review questions - find something congruent, how many days in a year, or give someone a kind compliment. Again, they get up and do this and then return to work independently. It’s a game changer and helps us learn so much. It also reminds us to do our exit ticket. Since I haven’t had it, the recess bell rings before I even have time to remember the exit ticket or to get ready. We’ve been late for recess and bus almost every day since it’s been down.

I play calming music right before transitions like recess, the students magically start getting ready. This gives my students the independence/responsibility to know what to do without a teacher always telling them. 

I have a student helper that it’s their job to tell Alexa to stop and they enjoy this job, again giving them responsibility. It is disguised as our class pet which is an elephant stuffie. She sits on top and is a part of our class. 

During a lesson if we need a quick reference or data of any kind we ask her… how do you spell, what is the biggest country, etc. without having to google it. 

I know this is personal but also helps with my teaching as I’m not stressed or worried. My boys are 12 and 10 but do not have phones yet, so when they walk home they call me on the Alexa instead. I am always working in my classroom and can quickly get the call as it comes through on my Alexa. I have missed almost every call of there’s and it causes a lot of frustration. 

We have lost so much learning, responsibility, independence, classroom routines, and management is suffering, and we miss our class pet (Yes, she was a part of our class named Echo). I know it may be hard for you to understand but it has caused more distributions and frustrations than you can imagine. 

I am asking for the sake of my students, the smooth running of my classroom and to give them the best learning opportunities possible (both academically and socially) that you will help me hook up my Alexa in the classroom. 

Thanks for your help, 
Melinda

P.S. I tried to highlight the main points as I know this is a lot to read. I really appreciate your time! 

Are you able to provide a test account? (If so, please add a test username and password for the requested app)
- N/A

05/22/2024 12:07 PM Linda Wagner: 
Which service does this request pertain to
- Other

Additional info
- Hi there, Khan Academy Kids is on the Approved AMDSB Online Tools list. However, we are unable to use it. We receive an error message "Your administrator has not given you access to this item.' Would you please confirm that we are able to use this app and if so, how to make it work? Thank you, Linda Wagner
briefDescription: SEA - Khan Academy Kids is not supported by AMDSB
